message.content:
cs.DS, cs.IR, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.CG. 

The paper deals with the construction of suffix trees, which is a fundamental data structure in string algorithms and falls under the category of data structures (cs.DS). The focus is on constructing a sparse suffix tree, which is relevant in information retrieval (cs.IR) and data mining (cs.DM) applications where only a subset of interesting suffixes need to be stored. The algorithm also involves lexicographic sorting and merging of suffixes, which are common operations in computational geometry (cs.CG) and combinatorial algorithms (cs.CC).
